content.div:
A new, full-length trailer for The Amazing Spider-Man has just landed, and it looks like it's about to blow the cobwebs off the tired franchise.

The movie explores Peter Parker's origins, taking us back to when he was a bullied kid in high school who was only just beginning to discover the benefits of running around town in a red leotard. Unlike Tobey Maguire's tortured, nerdy Peter, the Amazing Spider-Man trailer positions Andrew Garfield's Peter as a sarcastic smart-ass ("You seriously think I'm a cop? In a skin-tight red and blue suit?!?").

Unlike the previous three Spider-Man flicks, this one will delve into the story of what happened to Peter's parents. Also, we meet Peter's first love interest, Gwen Stacy (Emma Stone), who seems to know all about her boyfriend's secret identity, judging by this trailer.

Also joining in on the web-slinging wackiness is Denis Leary as Gwen's father and a police lieutenant on the hunt for Spider-Man, Martin Sheen and Sally Field as Uncle Ben and Aunt May, and Rhys Ifans as The Lizard.

Marc Webb (500 Days of Summer) directs. The 3D film hits theatres on July 3, 2012.

Watch the trailer below and let us know what you think in the comments.

jenm@dose.ca
